a pregnant woman with placenta Previa started to bleed as she went into labor .Her blood pressure was 80/50 mm Hg. A lower segment cesarean section was planned in view of acute shock. What type of anesthesia will you plan for this patient?

options.text: general anesthesia with IV induction by ketamine

options.label: B
options.text: Spinal anesthesia up to L4 level

options.label: C
options.text: General anesthesia with IV induction by propofol followed by maintenance with fluranes

questions.correct_answer: A. general anesthesia with IV induction by ketamine

questions.text: A 46- year old male patient was given subarachnoid block by bupivacaine heavy by the anesthetist . after 10 minutes he was found to have a BP of 72/44 mm Hg and heart rate of 52/min. On checking the level of block it was found to be T6. What isthe likely explanation for the bradycardia :

options.label: D
options.text: Block of cardio accelerator fibers of sympathetic origin

questions.text: During laryngoscopy and intubation procedure, all of these are true, except:

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The neck is flexed with extension at the atlanto-occipital joint

options.label: D
options.text: After insertion of laryngoscope, it is levered on the upper incisor to pull up the tongue and visualize the vocal cords

questions.correct_answer: B. The laryngoscope is held in the right hand introduced from the right side of the patient

questions.text: Correct regarding difference between adult n children resuscitation?

questions.text: Which anesthetic is contraindicated in chronic renal failure?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Predmedication: Opioids Muscle relaxants: Gllamine, Pipecuranium, Pancuronium. IV induction agents: Ketamine, Thiopentone (relative CI) Inhalational agents: Methoxyflurane, Enflurane, Sevoflurane
  • • Predmedication: Opioids
  • • Muscle relaxants: Gllamine, Pipecuranium, Pancuronium.
  • • IV induction agents: Ketamine, Thiopentone (relative CI)
  • • Inhalational agents: Methoxyflurane, Enflurane, Sevoflurane
  • • Sch, Desflurane and Propofol are safe

questions.text: A patient due to be taken for LSCS, develops hypotension within 7-8 min of spinal anesthesia. Drug(s) useful in treating this patient may include?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Fluid loading Vasopressors Phenylephrine (DOC) Ephedrine Norepinephrine/Epinephrine infusion i.v. Dopamine and Mephenteramine have also been tried Atropine for bradycardia
  • • Fluid loading
  • • Vasopressors Phenylephrine (DOC) Ephedrine Norepinephrine/Epinephrine infusion i.v. Dopamine and Mephenteramine have also been tried Atropine for bradycardia
  • • Phenylephrine (DOC) Ephedrine Norepinephrine/Epinephrine infusion i.v. Dopamine and Mephenteramine have also been tried Atropine for bradycardia
  • • Phenylephrine (DOC)
  • • Ephedrine
  • • Norepinephrine/Epinephrine infusion i.v.
  • • Dopamine and Mephenteramine have also been tried
  • • Atropine for bradycardia

questions.text: True regarding local anesthetics is/are?

options.label: A
options.text: Prilocaine is longer acting then bupivacaine

options.label: B
options.text: Tetracaine is more potent than lignocaine

options.label: C
options.text: Dibucaine is the longest acting local anesthetic

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A is incorrect. Prilocaine is intermediate acting, whereas bupivacaine is long acting LA Option E is incorrect. Cocaine has sympathomimetic activity and thus causes hypertension.
  • • Option A is incorrect. Prilocaine is intermediate acting, whereas bupivacaine is long acting LA
  • • Option E is incorrect. Cocaine has sympathomimetic activity and thus causes hypertension.
  • • Other options are correct

questions.text: Ifyou are asked to collect 4 serial samples from lumbar punctures, what should be done with the first sample?

options.label: A
options.text: Cell counts like total differential counts

questions.correct_answer: A. Cell counts like total differential counts
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Tube 1: Total cell count and differentials Tube 2: Glucose and protein Tube 3: Gram stain and culture Tube 4: Additional tests
  • • Tube 1: Total cell count and differentials
  • • Tube 2: Glucose and protein
  • • Tube 3: Gram stain and culture
  • • Tube 4: Additional tests
